comments.body:
I think you should also call `sched.executorDecommission(exec1, ExecutorDecommissionInfo("test", true))` (ie for exec1), to mimic the production behavior which would always decommission all executors on a decommissioned host.

In addition, I think we should also test decommissioning when the entire host hasn't been taken down ?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +675,679 @@
    // Decommission all executors on host0, to mimic CoarseGrainedSchedulerBackend.
    sched.executorDecommission(exec0, ExecutorDecommissionInfo("test", true))
    sched.executorDecommission(exec1, ExecutorDecommissionInfo("test", true))
